1678828542040350720.text:
It's easier to teach with examples, than to teach through highly specific instructions.

And it's easier to grade than it is to teach.

We think both of these are actually also true with ChatGPT/LLMs.

Let me explain:

1678828571140423680.text:
Now if you'll let me get really nerdy for a minute, this is also the reason a lot of AI people think that ChatGPT got so good

Because ChatGPT isn't just based off of examples

It's based off of preference between examples

1678828574357458944.text:
ChatGPT was created based on human feedback saying that this chat response is better than this chat response (called Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback)

Which makes intuitive sense. It's easier to grade than to teach.

1678768851948036096.text: I think we might start seeing ‚Äúdataset strategy‚Äù emerge as more and more non technical, non ML background folks get into adopting and implementing AI

1640586510641823744.text:
Had a really great flight today

One of my best hacks for choosing great wine at a restaurant.

Look for what's weird.

Most somms focus on building a well rounded wine list. Wines that will sell. Wines that make $$.

But a weird wine? It's usually there bc the somm is obsessed with it. Always get that wine.
